an4.237:1.6.pli: atthi, bhikkhave, kammaṁ akaṇhaasukkaṁ akaṇhaasukkavipākaṁ kammakkhayāya saṁvattati.
an4.237:1.6.en: neither dark nor bright deeds with neither dark nor bright results, which lead to the ending of deeds.

an4.237:5.1.pli: Katamañca, bhikkhave, kammaṁ akaṇhaasukkaṁ akaṇhaasukkavipākaṁ kammakkhayāya saṁvattati?
an4.237:5.1.en: And what are neither dark nor bright deeds with neither dark nor bright results, which lead to the ending of deeds?

an4.237:5.3.pli: Idaṁ vuccati, bhikkhave, kammaṁ akaṇhaasukkaṁ akaṇhaasukkavipākaṁ kammakkhayāya saṁvattati.
an4.237:5.3.en: These are called neither dark nor bright deeds with neither dark nor bright results, which lead to the ending of deeds.

mlDocs.title:
Numbered Discourses 4.237
24. Deeds
The Noble Path

an4.235:1.6.pli: atthi, bhikkhave, kammaṁ akaṇhaasukkaṁ akaṇhaasukkavipākaṁ kammakkhayāya saṁvattati.
an4.235:1.6.en: neither dark nor bright deeds with neither dark nor bright results, which lead to the ending of deeds.

an4.235:4.1.pli: Katamañca, bhikkhave, kammaṁ akaṇhaasukkaṁ akaṇhaasukkavipākaṁ kammakkhayāya saṁvattati?
an4.235:4.1.en: And what are neither dark nor bright deeds with neither dark nor bright results, which lead to the ending of deeds?

an4.235:4.2.pli: Tatra, bhikkhave, yamidaṁ kammaṁ kaṇhaṁ kaṇhavipākaṁ …pe… idaṁ vuccati, bhikkhave, kammaṁ akaṇhaasukkaṁ akaṇhaasukkavipākaṁ kammakkhayāya saṁvattati.
an4.235:4.2.en: It’s the intention to give up dark deeds with dark results, bright deeds with bright results, and both dark and bright deeds with both dark and bright results. These are called neither dark nor bright deeds with neither dark nor bright results, which lead to the ending of deeds.

an4.236:1.6.pli: atthi, bhikkhave, kammaṁ akaṇhaasukkaṁ akaṇhaasukkavipākaṁ kammakkhayāya saṁvattati.
an4.236:1.6.en: neither dark nor bright deeds with neither dark nor bright results, which lead to the ending of deeds.

an4.236:5.1.pli: Katamañca, bhikkhave, kammaṁ akaṇhaasukkaṁ akaṇhaasukkavipākaṁ kammakkhayāya saṁvattati?
an4.236:5.1.en: And what are neither dark nor bright deeds with neither dark nor bright results, which lead to the ending of deeds?

an4.236:5.2.pli: Tatra, bhikkhave, yamidaṁ kammaṁ kaṇhaṁ kaṇhavipākaṁ …pe… idaṁ vuccati, bhikkhave, kammaṁ akaṇhaasukkaṁ akaṇhaasukkavipākaṁ kammakkhayāya saṁvattati.
an4.236:5.2.en: It’s the intention to give up dark deeds with dark results, bright deeds with bright results, and both dark and bright deeds with both dark and bright results. These are called neither dark nor bright deeds with neither dark nor bright results, which lead to the ending of deeds.

an4.233:1.6.pli: atthi, bhikkhave, kammaṁ akaṇhaasukkaṁ akaṇhaasukkavipākaṁ kammakkhayāya saṁvattati.
an4.233:1.6.en: neither dark nor bright deeds with neither dark nor bright results, which lead to the ending of deeds.

an4.233:5.1.pli: Katamañca, bhikkhave, kammaṁ akaṇhaasukkaṁ akaṇhaasukkavipākaṁ kammakkhayāya saṁvattati?
an4.233:5.1.en: And what are neither dark nor bright deeds with neither dark nor bright results, which lead to the ending of deeds?

an4.233:5.3.pli: idaṁ vuccati, bhikkhave, kammaṁ akaṇhaasukkaṁ akaṇhaasukkavipākaṁ kammakkhayāya saṁvattati.
an4.233:5.3.en: These are called neither dark nor bright deeds with neither dark nor bright results, which lead to the ending of deeds.

an4.234:3.8.en: neither dark nor bright deeds with neither dark nor bright results, which lead to the ending of deeds.

an4.234:7.1.en: And what are neither dark nor bright deeds with neither dark nor bright results, which lead to the ending of deeds?

an4.234:7.3.pli: idaṁ vuccati, brāhmaṇa, kammaṁ akaṇhaasukkaṁ akaṇhaasukkavipākaṁ kammakkhayāya saṁvattati.
an4.234:7.3.en: These are called neither dark nor bright deeds with neither dark nor bright results, which lead to the ending of deeds.

mn57:7.6.pli: atthi, puṇṇa, kammaṁ akaṇhaṁ asukkaṁ akaṇhaasukkavipākaṁ, kammakkhayāya saṁvattati.
mn57:7.6.en: neither dark nor bright deeds with neither dark nor bright results, which lead to the ending of deeds.

mn57:11.1.pli: Katamañca, puṇṇa, kammaṁ akaṇhaṁ asukkaṁ akaṇhaasukkavipākaṁ, kammakkhayāya saṁvattati?
mn57:11.1.en: And what are neither dark nor bright deeds with neither dark nor bright results, which lead to the ending of deeds?

mlDocs.title:
Middle Discourses 57
The Ascetic Who Behaved Like a Dog

an4.238:4.1.pli: Katamañca, bhikkhave, kammaṁ akaṇhaasukkaṁ akaṇhaasukkavipākaṁ kammakkhayāya saṁvattati?
an4.238:4.1.en: And what are neither dark nor bright deeds with neither dark nor bright results, which lead to the ending of deeds?

an4.238:4.3.pli: idaṁ vuccati, bhikkhave, kammaṁ akaṇhaasukkaṁ akaṇhaasukkavipākaṁ kammakkhayāya saṁvattati.
an4.238:4.3.en: These are called neither dark nor bright deeds with neither dark nor bright results, which lead to the ending of deeds.

mn101:2.7.pli: āyatiṁ anavassavā kammakkhayo; kammakkhayā dukkhakkhayo; dukkhakkhayā vedanākkhayo; vedanākkhayā sabbaṁ dukkhaṁ nijjiṇṇaṁ bhavissatī’ti.
mn101:2.7.en: With nothing to come up in the future, deeds end. With the ending of deeds, suffering ends. With the ending of suffering, feeling ends. And with the ending of feeling, all suffering will have been worn away.’

mn101:10.8.pli: āyatiṁ anavassavā kammakkhayo; kammakkhayā dukkhakkhayo; dukkhakkhayā vedanākkhayo; vedanākkhayā sabbaṁ dukkhaṁ nijjiṇṇaṁ bhavissatī”ti.
mn101:10.8.en: With nothing to come up in the future, deeds end. With the ending of deeds, suffering ends. With the ending of suffering, feeling ends. And with the ending of feeling, all suffering will have been worn away.”

an4.232:1.6.pli: atthi, bhikkhave, kammaṁ akaṇhaasukkaṁ akaṇhaasukkavipākaṁ kammakkhayāya saṁvattati.
an4.232:1.6.en: There are neither dark nor bright deeds with neither dark nor bright results, which lead to the ending of deeds.

mn14:17.8.pli: āyatiṁ anavassavā kammakkhayo, kammakkhayā dukkhakkhayo, dukkhakkhayā vedanākkhayo, vedanākkhayā sabbaṁ dukkhaṁ nijjiṇṇaṁ bhavissatī”ti.
mn14:17.8.en: With nothing to come up in the future, deeds end. With the ending of deeds, suffering ends. With the ending of suffering, feeling ends. And with the ending of feeling, all suffering will have been worn away.”
